meanings.definition: Convert or attempt to convert someone from one religion, belief, or opinion to another.
meanings.sent1: She proselytizes her friends to try new foods.
meanings.sent2: The preacher proselytizes to the community every Sunday.
meanings.sent3: He proselytizes so much about his favorite TV show that his friends tease him about it.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the new fitness trend proselytizes even the most skeptical individuals.
meanings.sent5: The passionate speaker proselytizes with such conviction that many are swayed by her words.

meanings.definition: Advocate or promote a particular cause or belief.
meanings.sent1: The charity organization proselytizes for donations to help those in need.
meanings.sent2: The politician proselytizes for better healthcare for all citizens.
meanings.sent3: He proselytizes for his favorite sports team so much that his friends have started supporting them too.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to environmental conservation proselytizes others to take action for the planet.
meanings.sent5: The teacher proselytizes the importance of reading to her students every day.
